title: too much armor reduction in this game
body:
dumb how much armor you can buy and how little it starts to matter unless you get fed and nobody else does

{{item:3071}} - take 24% of your armor out of the equation for all AD champs hitting you
{{item:3147}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3814}} take anywhere from 18-54 armor out of the equation
{{item:3036}} take 35% of your armor out of the equation
{{item:3033}} take 25% of your armor (and 40% of your healing) out of the equation 
Conqueror - 20% true damage conversion; becomes much stronger the more armor you have (not an OP rune, just worth listing)
not even including how many fighters tend to have innate armor reduction or mixed/true damage these days

these things wouldn't be terrible by themselves, but you can stack them; meaning any assassin who's meant to kill squishies can stack most of these items up and suddenly they're able to chew up a bruiser or tank - two groups who are meant to be resilient against them. hell, I pretty commonly run {{item:3071}} {{item:3036}} on juggernauts like Urgot and Illaoi and it's almost disgusting with how someone dedicating most of their build to surviving me can't even come near me after I finish Regards.

If we're not going to reduce the amount of armor reduction in the game, can we at least make it less palatable an option to just stack them up and be able to make anyone your bitch? I'd be totally okay with lowering the total amount of armor you can feasibly get to avoid a hard swing into armor being OP.
